business.headline: Vijay Mallya discontinues bankruptcy annulment application in UK ahead of hearingThis means the "Trustee in Bankruptcy" can continue to pursue assets to help a consortium of banks led by the State Bank of India (SBI) realise the repayment of an estimated judgment debt of around 1.05 billion pounds owed by Vijay Mallya's now-defunct Kingfisher Airlines.

Diwali shopping on credit cards? Here's how offers can backfireFestive sales and flashy credit card deals may look irresistible, but hidden charges, interest traps and repayment delays can turn Diwali shopping into a debt headache.

Retail inflation drops to 1.54% in September, lowest in over 8 yearsFood inflation remained negative for the fourth consecutive month, with the Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI) showing a year-on-year decline of 2.28%.

Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion, Peter Howitt win Nobel Prize in Economics 2025The Nobel Prize committee said the trio's research has helped economists and policymakers better understand the roots of economic progress.
Sensex, Nifty end in red as IT stocks drag markets; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 173.77 points to close at 82,327.05, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 58 points to end at 25,227.35.
Is silver the next big story after gold? Here's what you need to knowFrom households to industries and even central banks, silver is suddenly everyone's favourite metal, pushing its price higher.

Loan rejected despite 750 CIBIL score? 5 hidden reasons revealed by expertEven with a strong CIBIL score of 750, many borrowers face loan rejections. Experts say banks consider several hidden factors beyond your credit score that can impact approval.

Is Diwali bonus taxable for salaried employees? Here's what you must knowAs Diwali draws near, salaried employees across India look forward to festive bonuses and gifts. But not all perks are tax-free, and understanding which ones attract tax is essential to avoid surprises from the Income Tax Department.

LG Electronics IPO GMP rises: Can investors expect 50% listing pop tomorrow?LG IPO: While early chatter hinted at a 50% listing pop, current indicators suggest a slightly more modest, yet still impressive, gain. Read on to know more about the grey market trends, subscription frenzy, and what investors can realistically expect tomorrow.

Crypto rebounds after massive crash. Here's what investors should doThe crypto market has regained lost ground following a sharp crash over the weekend. Bitcoin, Ethereum, and several altcoins are bouncing back, leaving investors to decide their next move carefully.

Gold prices climb again. Will the rally continue till Dhanteras?Gold is once again on the rise, drawing attention from investors and festive buyers alike. With prices touching record levels and global uncertainty at play, many are now wondering if the momentum will carry through to Dhanteras.

Why Tata Capital's weak stock market debut isn't a reason to worryTata Capital IPO: The shares opened at Rs 330 on listing day, roughly 1% above the IPO price of Rs 326—a flat, polite start for what was billed as the biggest public issue of the year.
Tata Capital share price: 2025's biggest IPO makes flat debut on stock marketTata Capital shares listed at Rs 330 on both the NSE and the BSE, opening at a premium of just 1% over its issue price.

Sensex tumbles nearly 400 points: Why is the stock market falling today?Across Asia, markets opened lower, and India wasn't spared either. Profit booking after last week's gains and cautious sentiment ahead of key domestic events like the Tata Capital listing, Q2 earnings, and inflation data added to the drag.

LG Electronics IPO set for a bumper listing tomorrow? Check latest GMPLG Electronics IPO was open for subscription from October 7 to October 9 and saw strong participation across all investor categories.

Sensex, Nifty fall amid US-China tariff tensions; focus on Tata Capital listingThe S&P BSE Sensex fell over 300 points in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped around 100 points amid mild profit booking after last week's gains.

Tata Capital share listing today: Will investors see profit from biggest IPO in 2025?The Rs 15,511.87 crore IPO, which opened for subscription on October 6 and closed on October 8, received bids for 65.33 crore shares against 33.34 crore shares on offer, subscribing 1.96 times overall.

What's in a Will? Understanding the power of your last wordFrom Bollywood dramas where brothers turn against each other to real-life stories of families dragged into courtrooms, most of these disputes begin with one missing document, a will.

Why Indians still prefer buying homes during auspicious monthsBuying a home in India is more than just a financial decision — it is an emotional milestone. For many, choosing the right time to invest is as important as picking the right property, with festivals and auspicious dates playing a big role.

Crypto crash wipes out $19 billion after Trump's 100% China tariffs spark sell-offThe cryptocurrency market suffered a historic crash after US President Donald Trump announced 100% tariffs on China and new export controls on software.

entertainment.headline: Stranger Things 5: Volume 1 episode runtimes revealed after fan buzz The co-creator of 'Stranger Things', Ross Duffer, has clarified that the final season's episodes will not be the lengthy 90-minute features as rumoured on social media. Netflix will release the last season in three parts starting November 26.

Eminem's daughter Alaina Marie announces pregnancy with husband Matt Moeller Eminem is gearing up to be a grandfather once more! His eldest daughter, Alaina Marie Scott, and her husband, Matt Moeller, are expecting their first child in 2026. The announcement, brimming with love and gratitude, quickly melted hearts online.

Actor Alec Baldwin's Range Rover crashes into tree near Hamptons home Actor Alec Baldwin narrowly escaped injury when his Range Rover crashed into a tree in the Hamptons amid rainy weather. Despite the accident, he and his brother remained unhurt, and no official statements have been released yet.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 51: Farrhana-Shehbaz clash, pani puri task sets nominations The October 13 episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' had emotions, fights, and changing alliances, ending with a fun yet chaotic pani puri nominations task. Nehal saved Farrhana, while Gaurav, Mridul, Neelam, and Malti were up for public voting.

Amitabh Bachchan fulfils promise, gifts washroom to KBC contestant's family Amitabh Bachchan gifted a washroom to 'KBC' contestant Jayanta Dhule's family in Arambagh, Hooghly, fulfilling a promise he made on the show. The gesture has brought joy and improved hygiene for the women in the family, earning heartfelt gratitude from them.

Anupam Kher learns to dance at 68, grooves to Tauba Tauba. Watch Actor Anupam Kher surprised fans by sharing his first-ever dance video, showcasing a hook step he learned from choreographer Caesar. The 68-year-old actor said he took up dancing as a new challenge, proving it's never too late to try something new.

Bridgerton Season 4 release date: When and where to watch the two-part series Makers have announced the release dates for 'Bridgerton' Season 4, which will drop in two parts: Part 1 on January 29 and Part 2 on February 26. The season follows Benedict Bridgerton's romantic journey with Sophie Baek, inspired by Julia Quinn's 'An Offer from a Gentleman'.

Shatrughan celebrates Kishore Kumar's legacy: Complete entertainer, forever loved Veteran actor Shatrughan Sinha paid an emotional tribute to Kishore Kumar on his death anniversary today. He shared a post and recalled his timeless legacy.

Amitabh Bachchan's emotional post celebrates triple victory for Bachchan family The Bachchan family made headlines at the Filmfare Awards 2025, with Amitabh, Jaya, and Abhishek each winning a trophy. Amitabh thanked fans for their support with a special social media post.

Taylor Swift announces Eras Tour documentary and finale film Pop star Taylor Swift to release a six-episode docuseries and concert film covering her Eras Tour. The series offers viewers behind-the-scenes insights and highlights fan traditions.

Kantara Chapter 1 ending, Berme's fight explained: Is the 3rd film loading? Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' ends on a powerful note, leaving fans curious about what's next. Here's the full ending explained -- from Berme's divine awakening to hints of what makes a third film in Shetty's mythological universe.

Anshula Kapoor talks about body image and self-acceptance: I have been hypercritical Anshula Kapoor shared an Instagram post reflecting on her journey with body image and self-acceptance, encouraging self-compassion and positivity.

Aneet Padda enjoys Coldplay concert with Ahaan Panday ahead of 23rd birthday Aneet Padda had a great time at the Coldplay concert with Ahaan Panday ahead of her 23rd birthday. Several pictures of the duo enjoying themselves have emerged online.

BTS' Jungkook surprises Mingyu's livestream, joins pretty woman dance challenge BTS' Jungkook joins SEVENTEEN's Mingyu's Instagram livestream for an impromptu interaction. The pair discuss plans for a joint dance challenge and future livestream together.

Aadhyayasree and Sukriti Paul declared joint winners of Super Dancer 5 Super Dancer 5 concluded with Aadhyayasree Upadhyay and Sukriti Paul being declared joint winners, each receiving Rs 10 lakh, a grand trophy, and exclusive sponsor gifts.

Pics: Hrithik Roshan enjoys fun-filled night out with Storm cast Hrithik Roshan celebrated his OTT production debut with the thriller 'Storm', enjoying a fun evening with the star-studded cast and director Ajitpal Singh.

How Dragon Ball Z became the blueprint for every modern shonen In this week's Animania, we discover how 'Dragon Ball Z' set the blueprint for modern shonen anime and inspired a generation of heroes, battles, and unforgettable power-ups.

Yogi Adityanath congratulates Ravi Kishan, says award inspires UP, Bhojpuri artists Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath shared a message for Ravi Kishan after he won the Filmfare Award for Best Supporting Actor for his performance in 'Laapataa Ladies'.

OTT this week: The Diplomat, Good News and more - What to watch, where and when This week, fans can look forward to some interesting films and shows releasing on streaming platforms. Here's a glimpse at this week's binge-watching guide, featuring political thrillers, documentaries, and crime dramas.

general news.headline: Trump praises 'good friend' Modi in Egypt, gestures to Shehbaz Sharif behind himDonald Trump, co-hosting the Gaza Peace Summit in Sharm el-Sheikh alongside Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, also praised Pakistani PM and said regional peace "depends on good friends doing good things".

Starship's Super Heavy rocket crashes, explodes in Gulf of MexicoMoments after liftoff, the Starship separated from the Super Heavuy rocket, which the company calls hot staging. The rocket then, as planned, crashed in the Gulf of Mexico.

Haryana top cop Shatrujeet Kapur sent on leave amid IPS officer's suicide rowHaryana DGP Shatrujeet Kapur was sent on leave after a senior IPS officer's suicide note named him for alleged harassment. The 52-year-old Kumar allegedly shot himself dead at his Sector 11 residence on October 7.

Shehbaz Sharif glorifies Trump in Egypt, credits him for halting war with IndiaShehbaz Sharif praised Donald Trump at the Sharm el-Sheikh Summit, backing his claim of mediating peace between nuclear powers India and Pakistan. Sharif called Trump "a man of peace" and endorsed him for the Nobel Peace Prize.

Why a young KBC contestant's behaviour has put his parents in the firing lineTen-year-old KBC contestant Ishit Bhatt has become the butt of memes and jokes on social media, and the reason is his overconfident demeanour. His parents, too, have been dragged into this, with strangers dissecting their "parenting style" based on a few televised minutes. Is that fair?

Congress to contest around 60 seats in Bihar, Tejashwi to fight from RaghopurSeat-sharing negotiations between the RJD and the Congress have been settled for almost all seats, except a few where both parties have staked claim, as per sources.

You don't mind being called beautiful, right? Trump gushes over Meloni in EgyptUS President Donald Trump drew attention after calling Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni "a beautiful young woman," praising her as an "incredible leader" in Egypt summit.

Firing, blasts heard near LoC as Army foils suspected infiltration bid in J&KFiring and explosions were reported along the Line of Control (LoC) near Machil and Dudniyal in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara as the Indian Army foiled a suspected infiltration attempt.

Kantara Chapter 1 ending, Berme's fight explained: Is the 3rd film loading?Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' ends on a powerful note, leaving fans curious about what's next. Here's the full ending explained -- from Berme's divine awakening to hints of what makes a third film in Shetty's mythological universe.

Starship crashes in Indian Ocean exactly where Elon Musk wanted itThe precision of the landing shows SpaceX's growing mastery in guidance and control systems, marking a major step toward future missions.

Afghanistan rejects Pak truce bid, denies visas to defence minister, ISI chiefThe visa requests of Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif, ISI chief Asim Malik, and two other Pakistani generals have been rejected three times over the past three days.

Strategic restraint or missed opportunity? Shashi Tharoor on PM skipping Gaza meetCongress leader Shashi Tharoor said that India's decision to send a Minister of State to the Gaza peace summit in Egypt "stands in stark contrast to the heads of state gathered there".

PM welcomes release of Israeli hostages, lauds Trump's 'unwavering peace efforts'PM Modi, in a post on X, said the Israeli hostages' freedom is a tribute to the courage of their families and expressed support for President Trump's efforts to bring peace to the region.

Bihar court summonses to Rahul Gandhi, Tejashwi Yadav over PM abuse rowThe order was passed by Chief Judicial Magistrate of Sheikhpura, Vibha Rani, on a complaint filed by BJP leader Hiralal Singh on September 4.

In Israeli parliament, Trump once again claims he stopped India-Pak conflictFor the umpteenth time, US President Donald Trump, speaking in the Israeli parliament, claimed he averted a war between nuclear arch-rivals India and Pakistan following their brief four-day military conflict in May.

Texas businessman expelled from church, gym over anti-India immigration postTexas businessman Daniel Keene was expelled from his church and lost $8,000 in sales after his post on X criticising Indian immigrants and H-1B visas went viral. The post, featuring a Ganesh Chaturthi procession, sparked accusations of xenophobia. In his open letter to church, Keene defended his stance and claimed that it was not about preserving the cultural identity of the US.

10 college degrees that no longer pay off, as per Harvard reportHarvard economists highlight that the value of some traditional degrees, like computer science, engineering, and business, declines over time due to fast-changing job skills. Continuous upskilling is essential, as not all degrees guarantee long-term career returns.

Bengaluru man quits corporate job for family, now earns more as Uber driverA Bengaluru man began his career with Reliance Retail, where he worked for eight years, earning around Rs 40,000 per month. Now, he is an Uber driver and earns Rs 56,000 a month.

3 posh Delhi malls, on brink of closure, get water reliefWater supply to three popular south Delhi malls - Ambience Mall, DLF Promenade and DLF Emporio - has resumed, ending an unprecedented crisis that threatened to shut down operations in the glitzy shopping hubs with Diwali approaching.

India slams Pakistan at UNGA, praises Op Sindoor as response to cross-border terrorIndia strongly criticised Pakistan at the UNGA for terrorism and child rights abuses. In a sharp counter to Pakistan's remarks at the UNGA, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey also accused Islamabad of targeting civilians.

Actor Alec Baldwin's Range Rover crashes into tree near Hamptons homeActor Alec Baldwin narrowly escaped injury when his Range Rover crashed into a tree in the Hamptons amid rainy weather. Despite the accident, he and his brother remained unhurt, and no official statements have been released yet.

You look great, but stop smoking: Erdogan quips to Meloni at Egypt summitIn the short video, which quickly went viral, Erdogan is seen greeting Meloni with a broad smile before quipping, "I saw you coming down from the plane. You look great. But I have to make you stop smoking."

Israel and Hamas free hostages under US-brokered ceasefire dealIsrael and Hamas took a cautious step toward peace by exchanging hostages in a US-brokered ceasefire. The deal brings hope but core issues like disarmament and governance remain unresolved.

US shutdown could be the longest ever, as stalemate enters third weekRepublican Speaker Mike Johnson warns the US government shutdown could become the longest in history. The deadlock over Obamacare subsidies deepens division and delays reopening talks.

The women of Kantara Chapter 1: Rishab Shetty turns feminine into cinematic powerRishab Shetty expands his cinematic universe in 'Kantara: Chapter 1', turning women into the story's driving force. From divine strength to human resilience, the prequel moves the gender conversation in the story with myth, strength, and power.

Actor Alec Baldwin's Range Rover crashes into tree near Hamptons homeActor Alec Baldwin narrowly escaped injury when his Range Rover crashed into a tree in the Hamptons amid rainy weather. Despite the accident, he and his brother remained unhurt, and no official statements have been released yet.

sports.headline: Eager to see Ro-Ko back in Australia, hope Kohli scores 2 hundreds: Harbhajan Harbhajan Singh said that he is excited to see Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli back in action during the Australia tour. Harbhajan also hopes that Kohli will score atleast two hundreds during the tour down under.

Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana says team left in tears after heartbreaking SA loss Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana said that her team was left in tears after their heartbreaking loss to South Africa in Vizag. Sultana said she was proud of the team's efforts in the close encounter against the Proteas.

Play the spinners effectively: Maddy Green on how New Zealand can beat Sri Lanka New Zealand's Maddy Green believes that the key to beating Sri Lanka in their World Cup league-fixtures is to play their spinners effectively.

We've done well against New Zealand in the past, but that's history: Rumesh Ratnayake Sri Lanka head coach, Rumesh Ratnayake, believes that their side may have done well against New Zealand in the recent past, but now it doesn't matter as they face a crucial game in the league stages.

Women's World Cup: Kapp-Tryon fifties help South Africa survive Bangladesh scare Women's World Cup 2025: Bangladesh's spirited bowling effort and late drama in the field weren't enough as South Africa's experienced duo, Marizanne Kapp and Chloe Tryon, held their nerve to seal a tense three-wicket win in a thriller at the Women's World Cup.

How West Indies countered Kuldeep Yadav after taking five wickets in first innings Kuldeep Yadav dominated West Indies in the first innings with a five-wicket haul. Despite this, Campbell and Hope's twin centuries in the second innings showcased West Indies' resilience and tactical adaptation.

Italy's road to redemption: Gattuso warns of Israel danger in must-win tie Italy prepares for a decisive World Cup qualifying match against Israel in Udine, as coach Gennaro Gattuso warns of Israel's attacking quality and heightened security measures accompany a large pro-Palestinian march in the city.

Ashes 2025: Freed from captaincy, Joe Root ready to end century dry spell Down Under Joe Root is determined to end his century drought in Australia during the 2025 Ashes series. His renewed focus and team-first mindset could be key to England reclaiming the Ashes urn.

IND vs WI, 2nd Test: Washington Sundar jokes about Delhi Test going to Day 5 India vs West Indies: After West Indies' spirited batting display on Day 4, Washington Sundar praised the Indian bowlers, saying taking 20 wickets on a slow Delhi pitch was commendable. India are closing in on a dominant win in the capital and a 2-0 series sweep.

Rohit Sharma worked hard after being called out for fitness, reveals ex-coach Former India batting coach Sanjay Bangar compared Rohit Sharma's recent fitness transformation ahead of his ODI comeback in Australia to the hard work he put in after being dropped from the 2011 World Cup squad. Rohit has reportedly shed 10 kg as he gears up for his first international appearance since March.

After Asia Cup fiasco, Pakistan hockey tells players to take sensible route vs India The Pakistan Hockey Federation has told its players to avoid any confrontations with the Indian stars during their upcoming clash at the Sultan Of Johor Cup in Malaysia on Tuesday, October 14.

India are closing in on a dominant win in the capital and a 2-0 series sweep.

Rohit has reportedly shed 10 kg as he gears up for his first international appearance since March.

After Asia Cup fiasco, Pakistan hockey tells players to take sensible route vs India The Pakistan Hockey Federation has told its players to avoid any confrontations with the Indian stars during their upcoming clash at the Sultan Of Johor Cup in Malaysia on Tuesday, October 14.

Delhi Test: India find positives in bowling grind despite follow-on criticismIndia vs West Indies, 2nd Test:** All-rounder Washington Sundar said the conditions in Delhi were not bowler-friendly and expressed satisfaction with India managing to take 20 wickets despite a late fightback from the West Indies. India need 58 runs with nine wickets in hand to win the Test on Day 5.

PAK vs SA 1st Test: Noman Ali's 'welding glasses' and spin heroics light up Lahore TestNoman Ali's spin wizardry and 'welding glasses' left South Africa reeling on Day 2 in Lahore, as Pakistan's spinners once again dominated, reducing the visitors to a struggling position and keeping the home side firmly in control of the Test.

Neymar remains in Brazil's plans, but must regain fitness for recall: AncelottiBrazil manager Carlo Ancelotti said that Neymar still remains in his plans but said that the Santos star needs to regain his fitness. Neymar has been struggling to remain fit ever since his major injury in 2023.

Watch: Babar Azam shows sharp reactions at slips, takes blinder to dismiss RickeltonBabar Azam returned to Test whites with a stunning catch against South Africa in Lahore. His fielding brilliance and spin bowling dominance set the tone, but batting concerns remain for Pakistan.

Ben Stokes, Mark Wood are raring to go for Ashes in Australia: Brydon CarseEngland pacer Brydon Carse has said that Ben Stokes and Mark Wood are raring to go for the Ashes series in Australia. Stokes and Wood are making their recoveries from respective injuries.

Gritty West Indies make India toil, stretch Delhi Test to Day 5India vs West Indies, 2nd Test: West Indies showed rare grit with the bat on Day 4, frustrating India and stretching the Delhi Test to its final day, while India's follow-on and declaration decisions drew scrutiny from fans and experts alike.

Former Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere named as Luton Town managerFormer Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere has been named as the new manager of Luton Town as the former England international looks to turn around the fortunes of the club.

Kuldeep Yadav sets unwanted record, concedes 100 for 1st time in Delhi TestKuldeep Yadav conceded 100 runs for the first time in his Test career as West Indies fought back in Delhi. His costly spell highlighted India's struggles and put pressure on captain Shubman Gill's decision to enforce the follow-on.

Former Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere named as Luton Town managerFormer Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere has been named as the new manager of Luton Town as the former England international looks to turn around the fortunes of the club.

Kuldeep Yadav sets unwanted record, concedes 100 for 1st time in Delhi TestKuldeep Yadav conceded 100 runs for the first time in his Test career as West Indies fought back in Delhi. His costly spell highlighted India's struggles and put pressure on captain Shubman Gill's decision to enforce the follow-on.

PCB readies backup plans as Afghanistan participation in tri-series in doubt: ReportThe Pakistan Cricket Board is preparing an alternate plan for the upcoming tri-series amid doubts over Afghanistan's participation due to military tensions.

War of words begin for Ashes as Warner takes moral victory dig at EnglandThe war of words have begun ahead of the Ashes series. Former Australia player David Warner, has said that England are coming Down Under only for a moral victory.

Pat Cummins hints that he is unlikely to make it for 1st Ashes TestAustralia captain Pat Cummins hinted that he is unlikely to be fit in time for the first Ashes Test in Perth against England. Cummins is continuing his recovery from a back stress injury.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli for 2027 World Cup? Ravi Shastri makes massive callRavi Shastri says Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's ODI future is uncertain. The upcoming three-match series against Australia will be crucial in deciding if the senior duo continues toward the 2027 World Cup.

India white-ball series ideal Ashes preparation: Australia captain Mitchell MarshMitchell Marsh believes Australia's white-ball series against India is perfect preparation for the 2025–26 Ashes, with the two sides always sharing a great rivalry. Facing world No. 1 India provides match intensity and competitive practice ahead of England's historic Test series in Perth.

Follow-on blunder? Gambhir slammed as India's 12-year streak ends in Delhi TestIndia vs West Indies, 2nd Test: Head coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill have faced flak for the decision to enforce follow-on in Delhi. West Indies put up an admirable fight with the bat in their second innings to force India to bat again, ending a 13-year-long streak.

At 14, Vaibhav Suryavanshi becomes vice-captain of Bihar Ranji Trophy teamVaibhav Suryavanshi, 14, has been named vice-captain of Bihar for the first two rounds of Ranji Trophy 2025-26, after exceptional youth performances in Australia, England and the IPL. Sakibul Gani will lead the side as Bihar aims to rebound from a winless previous season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
